item.title: Doom Emacs
item.description: Doom tips Some tips to learn the keybindings in Doom and Vim in the process of migrating from my vanilla Emacs settings. Doom leader-key is SPC and localleader-key is SPC-m. When in Insert mode use M-SPC or M-SPC-m to call the menu available as in the Normal mode.

item.title: data.table tips
item.description: Some tips for data.table that I came across while googling which might be useful. Print To print more rows that default can be done with either: options(datatable.print.topn = 70) print(DT, topn = 70) Using options will implement the changes globally. Else to make print nicer is using:

item.title: Mount drive
item.description: Install Mount Execute Credential Access to folders First published date: 2021-02-22 This is only relevant to my personal reference at work. The address for drive F and N is as follow: F: = \\fhi.no\felles N: = \\fhi.no\fil\styrt H: = \\fhi.

item.title: Docker basic
item.description: Use image Create Image Mount directory Important commands: docker pull image-name docker run local-name image-name docker ps docker build Use image Some basic commands to start using Docker. Two things are important ie. Docker Image and Docker Container. To fetch RStudio image from Docker Hub run the command:

item.title: Connect to MS Access DB
item.description: This article first published in 02.10.2020. Before connecting to your Access DBMS via Windows OS, you can check if you have the MS Access driver installed in your machine by running ## List everything odbc::odbcListDrivers() ## You will get the results someting like this.

item.title: Ellipsis …
item.description: Just to remind me how I could use ellipsis or the three dots ... in my coding. There are two scenarios I find it useful: Function wrapper When creating a function wrapper and instead of providing all the arguments to be send further, you could just use .

item.title: Git upstream
item.description: When you forked a repo then your copy of forked-repo in your Github profile will be referred to as origin while upstream refers to the real origin where the repo was forked from. If you cloned a repo then you will only have local copy of the repo.

item.title: Git worktree
item.description: Normally I created a new branch when I intent to do some changes to the master branch. But the problem is I have to stash changes when switching back and forth. To avoid this create worktree for the branches you want to work seperately.

item.title: Case when
item.description: It’s often easier to use ifelse to implement conditioning. The fast implementation in data.table of ifelse is fifelse. Other approach to do multiple conditioning is to use data.table::fcase or dplyr::case_when. fcase fcase can be used directly x <- 1:6 data.table::fcase(x < 3, 1, x >= 4, 2) To implement in a data.

item.title: SSH-key with Git on Windows
item.description: Generally, these are what I did: Install git-with-openssh Create SSH-key Add SSH-key to ssh-agent Create ~/.bashrc for auto-launching ssh-agent openSSH Windows 10 include openSSH. But I can’t make it work with git so I use git-with-openssh installed via scoop.
